p.s: The Sonnet 65 by William Shakespeare published in the Elizabethan time, is about the season change between fall and winter and what happends during that time.
The sonnet has a ABAB rhyme scheme between line one and 12.
Line 13 and 14 have a AA rhyme scheme.
The author William Shakespeare writes at the begin of the sonnet that naturalistic things like brass and stones loosinglosing their effect.
Following he asks why this beautiful nature cannot resist the whole seasonal change.
He also asks which winter naturalistic action is a stronger than a flower.
After that he describes the last summer honey smells in the fall air and also asks why this can't stay through winter season.
Shakespeare names that season as wrackful so that it is like a gate to the beautiful spring time and he can't wait to reach that season next.
Then Shakespeare start asking again if someone has the power to skip the season or to hold it back so that the nature has not to spoil.
At the end he saissays that his love is written in black ink and that this is the only shiny thing then.
